intro: Manihot linearifolia, commonly known as the slender arrowleaf, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its elongated, linear leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
